data.title: ReFi Costa Rica — from Costa Rica to the world
data.description:
Welcome to ReFi Costa Rica! 

- Join us in the adventure of reconnecting people, bioregions, projects, and ecosystems regenerating our country to transform, catalyze and enable Costa Rica to stay at the forefront of ecological action to become an intersectional, high integrity, coordinated Multi-BioRegional-Regenerative Hub.

- Our motto is about supporting a blooming ecosystem of regenerative stakeholders from all corners of the country, a ReFi Bridge between urban and rural contexts, that respects, honors and thrives on the cultural diversity of inhabitants, ecosystems, and promotes the interrelatedness, cooperation and coordination of existing initiatives in Español and English. 

- Why Fund Us?
✅ Unique blend of pop culture + web3 + regenerative knowledge + already mapped big portion of the Regen Community through the different team members
✅ Clear milestones & measurable impact
✅ Strong local partnerships in Costa Rica and increase reach in Latin America
✅ Fun, engaging approach to serious social, ecological, and economic regeneration

- Core Team:

1. Arturo Montanaro (https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7310226635293614082 - https://x.com/LandiaRegen)
2. Randall Saborio (https://www.linkedin.com/in/randall-saborío-99446b50/ )
3. Esteban Solis ( https://www.linkedin.com/in/esteban-solís-hidalgo )
4. Stefan Fiedler (https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7310226635293614082/)
5. Ale Alvarado (https://www.linkedin.com/in/alejandro-buenridecr )
6. Gustavo Segovia (https://x.com/sepu85 )


- Concentric Circle and Allies:
1. Karla Córdoba Brenes, Cambiatus Co-Founder, Asoblockchain Vicepresident / Community Building, content creation, Social Currencies and DAOs co-design
2. Danielle Gennety, Diamante Bridge Collective / Community Building
3. Ronny Castillo, Gaia Impact / Fundación Madre Tierra Verde, investment vehicles codesign, funding strategies, tokenomics.  
4. Melissa Rivera Abarca, Fundación Madre Tierra Verde / innovation and community building.
5. Miranda, QUÉ CIUDAD / Co-Founder / social investment/ environmental performance
6. Ranulfo Paiva Sobrinho, Cambiatus Co-Founder / Community Building, Social Currencies and DAOs co-design
7. Francisco Grau, Nangu / Land regeneration
8. Pedro, Sendero-Jardín de Lolita / Community Building, culture
9. Agustín Matteri, United Species DAO / Locally-led Climate Resilience Strategist / Node activities in Nicoya bioregion landscape-ecosystem.
10. Lorena Erbure Cardozo, Ruta Ruda Co-Founder / social and conservation projects / cybersecurity
11. Omar Hurtado, CofiBlocks Co-Founder / Tourism and Coffee Production
12. Irene González Chen, Verdes Monteverde Coordinator / Journalist and Activist
13. Alejandro Solís, BIOTA / Ecosystem services, Member of CRUSA community
14. Charlotte Fradet, Unity Co-living, urban co-living spaces

## Pura Vida! | Gracias por tu apoyo | Thank you for your support!
data.problem:
- Pessimism, Hopelessness, Greed!

- Lack of public funding and engagement in Costa Rica with web3’s potential for ecological regeneration.

- The power of Web3 has yet to be fully realised in climate action as many of these technologies remain disconnected from communities on-the-ground. Access to funding, expertise, and technology is a major challenge - particularly in the Global South’s rural and indigenous communities who have massive potential to expand biodiversity protection and commons stewardship, but lack management, operations, resources, market access and funding to grow initiatives.

- Discoordination efforts in the intersection of agroecology and digital collaboration, with few incentives in the country for coordinated collective action.

- Need for cultural narratives that inspire regeneration (current media lacks compelling regenerative heroes).
data.solution:
- Empathy, Collaboration, Connection, Eduentertaiment

- Expanding our operations team to tackle larger-scale projects.

- Bioregional activators programs and scholarships to create, solidify and enhance community capacities in the web 3 realm for impact reporting, community validation and financing. 

- White Labelling products to solve identified needs of the demand such as community education guide to use quadratic funding, market directories, biodiversity credits, community asset vouchers, community attestation & crypto in English & Español.

- Increasing partnership and distribution efforts to share knowledge and increase action towards ecological restoration and regenerative action.

- The expansion and capacity building of dMRV methodologies co-development of regenerative cattle grazing methodologies for pilots in Costa Rica with Costaricaregenerativa.org and suelosvivos.org to make a took kit for bioregional regeneration leveraging GIS, biodiversity credits, Fundraising and community asset vouchers.

- Costa Rica is a global leader in conservation & sustainability, making it ideal for an intersectional web3-powered regeneration movement.

- Web3 tools (NFTs, DAOs, quadratic funding) can incentivize and track regenerative actions.

- "Sayariki" (Goku as a regenerative hero) provides a fun, culturally resonant way to engage communities.
data.missionSummary:
Workshops & Hackathons:
Teach web3 tools for regenerative projects (e.g., Gitcoin-style funding, regenerative NFTs, the actuality of money). Also involving local actors with vocational inclination for web 3, to onboard local stakeholders.

Partner with local universities & agroecology orgs (University for International Cooperation -https://uci.ac.cr/es/home-, Earth University -https://www.earth.ac.cr/-, CATIE -https://www.catie.ac.cr/en/-).

Social Media Campaign:
Short videos of "Sayariki" (Goku) explaining how web3 helps regeneration.
Meme contests for best regenerative actions.

Ecosystem Development
Mycelium connection with identified impact local actors such as:
monteverde-institute.org
https://www.avercr.org/
https://www.higueronescoop.org/es
https://biosur.org/ 

 And the worldwide ReFi ecosystem and Land Nodes
Muda-oe.com
ReFi Nodes
Green Pill Chapters

Collaborative Web3 Spaces (Capacity Building)
Integrated Dojo:
A digital learning hub where users:
Learn about web3 technologies, applications, and concepts
Meet, exchange with, and build community 
Engage with weekly or biweekly frequency
Execution driven physical learning hubs where users:
Engage in "Minga" (community work) documentation (upload photos/videos of tree planting, cleanups, etc.). Can hire/solicit extra support via associated partners.
Access agroecology courses (soil health, syntropic farming, biomimicry).

Regenerative Bounties:
Small grants (CELO/ETH/ecoins) for completing regenerative tasks (e.g., "Plant 100 native trees, get 50 DAI").

Test The "Henkidama" Art Project viability
Interactive Website:
Users submit proof of regenerative actions (e.g., "Minga" documentation).
Each submission charges the "henkidama" (visualized as growing on the site).
Finale: "Spirit Bomb Release" (Prize Distribution)
After 3 months, the "henkidama" is released as:
Prize pool (in crypto) for top contributors.
Poap badges for participants.
data.locationOfImpact: Bioregions in Costa Rica: Chorotega Blue Zone /Guanacaste, Huetar Este/San José, Chirripo/Central Mountain Range

data.description:
![photo ReFiCosta Rica](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_webp,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F78c67f18-fd76-4f28-8577-354cd792cb3d_1024x362.jpeg "group shot refi costa rica")

## Welcome to ReFi Costa Rica!  Join us in the adventure of reconnecting all the people  regenerating our country, with our capital city San José at the center of a collaborative movement to transform Costa Rica into a ReFi Lab for the World.

For our second Gitcoin Round we need your support to consolidate [Verano ReFi Costa Rica 2023: Regenerating our Optimism](https://www.cambiatus.com/es/verano-refi)  an inspiring collection of ReFi events to share what is possible and what is already happening in ReFi in Costa Rica..

For our second Gitcoin Campaign we have a goal to raise $20k to make the full vision of Verano ReFi Costa Rica a reality!

[![IMAGE ALT TEXT HERE](http://img.youtube.com/vi/YOUTUBE_VIDEO_ID_HERE/0.jpg)](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ai1KygCkTiE)


## Project Overview:

The ReFi Costa Rica Local Node project is dedicated to advancing regenerative finance and decentralized technology adoption in Costa Rica. With a special focus on areas beyond the capital city, San José, the project aims to foster a thriving ecosystem that promotes sustainable development, economic empowerment, and community engagement.

![photo ReFiCosta Rica](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2Fd2ad4fd8-761f-42c5-9489-c5441891cb2f_1024x683.jpeg "group shot refi costa rica")


## Project Goals and Impact:

+ _Local Engagement and Sustainable Development:_ The project seeks to introduce regenerative finance principles to regions such as Monteverde, Paraíso and Osa. By organizing events and workshops, it aims to showcase how decentralized technologies can drive sustainable economic growth while preserving the local environment and culture.
+ _Regional Empowerment:_ Through events in Monteverde, Paraíso and Osa, the project aims to empower local communities with innovative financial solutions. These solutions can align with regenerative practices, leading to the creation of sustainable livelihoods, businesses, and initiatives that benefit the region's unique characteristics.
+ _Community Collaboration:_ Collaborating with local partners, the project aims to facilitate collaboration among community members, organizations, and universities. By fostering a sense of shared purpose, it encourages the exchange of ideas, resources, and knowledge, leading to the creation of impactful regenerative projects.
+ _Inclusive Governance:_ In collaboration with [Cambiatus](https://www.cambiatus.com/), the project is committed to co-designing a governance framework that reflects the principles of regenerative finance. This framework aims to ensure inclusivity, transparency, and community-driven decision-making, enhancing the long-term sustainability of the local node.
+ _National and Global Integration:_ The project's vinculation with bigger events and organizations such as the II Encuentro ReFi Costa Rica during [Blockchain Jungle](https://blockchainjungle.com/) event and the Blockchain Week Costa Rica 2023 leadered by [AsoBlockchain](https://asoblockchain.org/) showcases the country's dedication to regenerative finance practices. Additionally, the involvement in the ReFi DAO event in Lisbon underscores Costa Rica's commitment to sharing insights on impactful governance and decision-making.
+ _Educational Advancement:_ Through collaborative master classes with [ULACIT](https://www.ulacit.ac.cr/) and [VIU](https://www.universidadviu.com/) universities, the project strives to educate students about the intersection of regenerative finance and decentralized technologies. By nurturing a skilled workforce, it aims to empower young minds to contribute to the sustainable development of Costa Rica's economy.


 
## Budget Breakdown:

Total Budget: $20,000

_**15% Event Planning and Execution:**_ Funding will be allocated to organize events in Monteverde, Osa and Paraíso, covering venue rentals, promotional materials, and logistical expenses. 

_**25% San José Event Collaborations:**_ Contributions towards monthly crypto meetups in partnership with AsoBlockchain, and organization of the II Encuentro ReFi Costa Rica during Blockchain Week Costa Rica 2023. 

_**10% Educational Workshops:**_ Costs associated with conducting master classes in collaboration with universities to educate the local community about blockchain technology. 

_**25% Governance Co-Design:**_ Allocation for collaborative efforts with Cambiatus to co-design an effective governance structure for the local node. 

_**25% ReFi DAO Event Participation:**_ Funding to attend the ReFi DAO event in Lisbon, representing Costa Rica and contributing insights to the global ReFi community. 



## Expected Outcomes:
+ Increased awareness and adoption of blockchain technology in Monteverde, Osa and Paraíso.
+ Stronger blockchain community engagement through San José events and collaborations with AsoBlockchain.
+ Enhanced knowledge and understanding of blockchain technology through educational master classes.
+ Well-defined and inclusive governance framework for the ReFi Costa Rica Local Node in collaboration with Cambiatus.
+ Meaningful contributions to the ReFi DAO event in Lisbon, elevating Costa Rica's presence and impact in the global ReFi community.

>**We invite you to be a part of this transformative journey by contributing to our campaign**. Your contribution will directly impact the growth and success of the ReFi Costa Rica Local Node and its endeavors. Together, we can drive regeneration, education, and innovation in Costa Rica's blockchain ecosystem.


## Results from Gitcoin Beta
For our Gitcoin Beta campaign we aimed to raise $50k to support “Verano ReFi” a series of events inside and outside San José and start working on our own website and learning path.  Considering the amount we raised with the mazing support from the Gitcoin Community and the ReFi DAO and Metacrisis matching funds (~ $5k) we decided to focus on one big event and a series of meetups to keep building our community, as well as creating content for social media and growing our following. 

## Events
We were able to organize and support the following events in San José, Costa Rica: 

1 One day event, our I Encuentro ReFi Costa Rica.  +40 people attending, 8 projects presenting, 3 keynotes
7 Cripto Cantinas ReFi. Reach:  +140 people
3 events as guests: +95 people


**I Encuentro ReFi Costa Rica (40 people attending)** 
On June 24th, 2023, the 1st ReFi Costa Rica 2023 Gathering took place in Barrio Escalante, San José. The event saw the participation of over 30 individuals and organizations who are driving regenerative finance initiatives from all corners of our country. The event was graced by the presence of Anna Kaic, representing ReFi DAO from Mexico, and was co-organized by Cambiatus, Gaia Impact, Sendero, and Diamante Bridge Collective – all founding organizations of ReFi Costa Rica. The event received support from AsoBlockchain Costa Rica.

[Luma Event](https://lu.ma/reficr-1enc?tk=PF8WHk) 
[Article on Substack](https://refisanjose.substack.com/p/i-encuentro-refi-costa-rica-2023)
Featured on [ReFi DAO.com blog](https://blog.refidao.com/visiting-refi-costa-rica/) thanks to [Anna Kaic](https://twitter.com/KaicAnna/status/1678500059652976642), who visited us from ReFi DAO to attend our event.


**Cripto Cantinas ReFi** (20 people attending per event approx.).  We joined forces with AsoBlockchain to support the weekly blockchain meetup in san José called Cripto Cantina. At least once a month, this meetup was focused on ReFi and facilitated by us: 

[**Criptocantina ReFi April (Topic: Gitcoin Beta)**](https://twitter.com/ReFiCostaRica_/status/1651297814557650945)

[**Cripto Cantina ReFi May #1 (Topic: Intro to ReFi Costa Rica and our projects)**](https://twitter.com/ReFiCostaRica_/status/1653896427636965376)

[**Cripto Cantina ReFi May #2 (Topic: Cripto Orosi pre-launch)**](https://twitter.com/ReFiCostaRica_/status/1659678250002440193) 

[**Cripto Cantina ReFi May #3 (Topic: Collaborative Businesses with CofiBlocks)**](https://twitter.com/AsoBlockchainCR/status/1663277334605037568) 

[**Cripto Cantina ReFi June (Topic:  Pre-event  I Encuentro ReFi Costa Rica)**](https://twitter.com/ReFiCostaRica_/status/1672334136608956416) 

[**Cripto Cantina ReFi July (Topic: Open Mic of local projects)**](https://twitter.com/ReFiCostaRica_/status/1689797122323841024)  

[**Cripto Cantina ReFi August  (Topic:  Governance, Decision Making and Redistribution)**](https://twitter.com/ReFiCostaRica_/status/1689802358614618112) 


**Events from other collectives that we supported:** 
Evento de Cripto Orosi (out of San José) (40pax)
[Master Class at ULACIT University](https://twitter.com/ReFiCostaRica_/status/1689798574404472832) (15pax)
Bitcoin Pizza Day May 25th (40pax)  [Speakers](https://twitter.com/hemp_pizza/status/1656378018653253633) 
[Video](https://twitter.com/hemp_pizza/status/1663179445170044929)

## Content
We also were able to create and strengthen our presence in social media and to host two episodes of the Pura Vida Hour, a twitter space showcasing the people and projects behind ReFi Costa Rica. We also supported the ReFi Latam community as co-hosts of its twitter space Espacios Latam.

[**Linktree and Social media**](https://linktr.ee/reficostarica)
[**Substack**](https://refisanjose.substack.com/)
[**Pura Vida Hour (online event / Twitter space)**](https://refisanjose.substack.com/p/pura-vida-hour-first-two-episodes) 
[**Espacios Latam**](https://twitter.com/ReFiLatinAmeric)


## Our numbers:  
275 people attending our events
53 members on Telegram
365 Followers:  Tw, Linkedin, substack, youtube
92 people connected + 219 reproductions of Pura Vida Hour (twitter space)

## The amazing people behind ReFi San José

Behind this campaign there is a group of motivated, seasoned and committed founders with years of experience in regenerative practices, community building, innovation, impact, blockchain technology, fundraising; and deeply connected with corporate, academic, government, civil and grassroots organizations in Costa Rica and Latam.

**Core Team Members**

1. Karla Córdoba Brenes, Cambiatus Co-Founder, Asoblockchain Vicepresident / Community Building, content creation, Social Currencies and DAOs co-design
2. Danielle Gennety, Diamante Bridge Collective / Community Building
3. Ronny Castillo, Gaia Impact / Fundación Madre Tierra Verde, investment vehicles codesign, funding strategies, tokenomics.  
4. Melissa Rivera Abarca, Fundación Madre Tierra Verde / innovation and community building.
5. Ranulfo Paiva Sobrinho, Cambiatus Co-Founder / Community Building, Social Currencies and DAOs co-design
6. Randall Saborío, Diamante Bridge Collective / eco-villages and local markets
7. Pedro García, Sendero-Jardín de Lolita / Community Building, culture


**Community Members / Founders**

1. Lila Behr, ReFi Researcher, solutions communicator.
2. Agustín Matteri, United Species DAO / Locally-led Climate Resilience Strategist / Node activities in Nicoya bioregion landscape-ecosystem.
3. Lorena Erbure Cardozo, Ruta Ruda Co-Founder / social and conservation projects / cybersecurity
4. Omar Hurtado, CofiBlocks Co-Founder / Tourism and Coffee Production
5. Irene González Chen, Verdes Monteverde Coordinator / Journalist and Activist
6. Alejandro Solís, BIOTA / Ecosystem services, Member of CRUSA community
7. Miranda, QUÉ CIUDAD / Co-Founder / social investment/ environmental performance
8. Francisco Grau, Nangu / Land regeneration
9. Charlotte Fradet, Unity Co-living, urban co-living spaces
10. Roxana Zamora, CriptoversePlax


## **Join us in regenerating our optimism and making a meaningful difference!**

![photo ReFiCosta Rica](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_webp,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F82b0072e-a1c5-46b7-9433-963aa7c74fbe_1024x683.jpeg "group shot refi costa rica")

![ReFiCosta bannerRica](https://pbs.twimg.com/profile_banners/1649198159749324801/1686780643/1500x500 "group shot refi costa rica")
data.title: ReFi Costa Rica: Regenerating our Optimism

questions.query: Is your project a member or past grantee of one of these networks?
What are your key active goals, plans, objectives or milestones for this year?
questions.explanation:
Create and develop collaborative spaces for digital & agroecological capacity-building to Increase Awareness, Engagement, Adoption, and Development of ReFi Web3
Create & Catalyse Local Ecological, Social, and Economic Impact by Bimonthly Web 3 webinars for community onboarding (web 3 on/off ramping in Costa Rica), Bloom Network, Common Approach.
Increase public awareness of how blockchain can support intersectional (ecological and social) regeneration in a friendly way by organizing Crypto Monthly Crypto Events in San Jose and Tamarindo in collaboration with local partners to catalyse community action.
Community education guide creation for Web 3 Ambassador Program for Regenerative organizations impact reporting Karma Gap, Gitcoin fundraising, DAO formation, in English & Español thought for vocational education and bioregional capacity building.
Covering tax and legal fees associated with the project if any.

We propose the meme "Sayariki", as a bioregional regeneration movement in Costa Rica that leverages web3 tools.

This initiative merges web3 engagement, regenerative culture, and pop-art storytelling (inspired by Dragon Ball’s Goku) to drive measurable impact in Costa Rica’s ecosystems and communities.

data.name: Regen Coordination
data.description: The Regen Coordination Round is a proposal for a GG21 community round centered on the themes of Coordi-nations 3, Cosmo-localism 2, Bio-Regionalism 3, and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) 3. Bringing together GreenPill Network 1, ReFi DAO 1, Celo Regional DAOs 1 and Regens Unite 1, we aim to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF. We have currently secured $60K in funding from Celo Public Goods, ReFi DAO and Greenpill and ask for Gitcoin’s backing as we embark on a shared mission to showcase how community coordination, Web3, and innovative financial mechanisms can enable ecological and social regeneration on a global scale.

data.title: ReFi DAO Local Node - Gitcoin Beta Round
ReFi DAO Local Node - Gitcoin Beta Round

questions.query: If applicable, describe how your project/community has been utilising or supporting the Celo ecosystem, or explain a roadmap for your plans to utilise, build with, or align with Celo.
questions.explanation:
We have done several events in which we thanked CELO as our sponsor (from previous GG campaigns)
https://lu.ma/reficr

And an Intro to Hypercerts in collaboration with Cripto Cantina 

https://lu.ma/2mztko2f
